sentence.Network_en: The court filiated the child born out of wedlock.

sentence.Network_en: So, that pedologist tells Russia , agricultural herd should be united in wedlock.

jx.jx_en_mean: Of parents not legally married to each other
jx.jx_cn_mean: 私生的：父母不是合法地结合在一起的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English wedlāc 'marriage vow', from wed 'pledge' (related to wed) + the suffix -lāc (denoting action)

entry.def: Wedlock is the state of being married.
If a baby is born in wedlock, it is born while its parents are married. If it is born out of wedlock, it is born at a time when its parents are not married.

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being a married couple voluntarily joined for life (or until divorce);

auth_sentence.content: Today, the out of wedlock interracial aspect carries less of a stigma.

auth_sentence.content: But an important reason women bear children out of wedlock is because they don't expect to find husbands.
